name: .VSSX File Extension
summary: Learn about .VSSX files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: A VSSX file contains stencils created by Microsoft Visio, a technical drawing program. It stores a collection of shapes, connectors, or other objects that can be used within a drawing. VSSX files are often used by organizations for distributing logos and other standard design elements that can be included in technical drawings.

content: Microsoft Visio is often utilized in business settings to organize, visualize, and communicate complex workflows, such as organizational charts, database models, business flowcharts, and software and network diagrams. Visio comes with VSSX files pre-installed, and users may create them, as well.
Microsoft introduced the VSSX format when it released Visio 2013. VSSX is a Zip-based format that replaced the binary-based VSS format, which was utilized by Visio in the 2000s.
NOTE: Visio 2013 and later versions still support VSS files. However, the VSSX format is the default format used by Visio to save stencils.

instructions: You can open, edit, and save VSSX files with Microsoft Visio (Windows). To add the shapes in a VSSX file to your installation of Visio, simply double-click the file and Visio will import the shapes into your stencils library.
You can also open VSSX files with Nevron Software MyDraw (multiplatform) and The Omni Group OmniGraffle (macOS).

windows.name: Open and view .VSSX files with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
